intro: Barbosella longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Barbosella longipes is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
